column4: what is the best way to install Gnome on a kubuntu Edgy system?
apt-get install gnome
thats a potential branch of the libata kernel, that ubuntu has chosen to bring to production status
what ?
with this UUID situation
how is that putting the cart before the horse
if you go to https://wiki.ubuntu.com/LibAtaForAtaDisks it seems as though we are testing this thing before it is ready
well it is in the libata branch and it may change - but thats ubuntu's choice to make it stable - not the linux kernel team
whats the difference in fesity or edgy - both are not LTS and even when fesity is released that libata branch still won't be main stream so why not in edgy
in other words I should have stuck with Dapper for now?
if you don't believe in the block id method - yes
it's not that I don't believe in it as much as I think it is not ready since it would not work correctly for me in one case
its not in the kernel mainstream yet - so log a bug / request for ubuntu - in say 7 months time the blkid method may not even exist
yes if you were replying to me, it is too general for a bug report
not sorry - not you
ty I thought maybe there was another option
how about rms?
certainly
did you see my pastebin?
no
that doesn't look right
what is wrong with it?
I will Google on it some more, thanks
I found the problem with my sudo line, I just had to move it up in the file above the line that gives access to admin group
